## Spicy Bean and Vegetable Stir-Fry (Low-Carb Dinner for 4)

A quick, flavorful low-carb stir-fry using beans and fresh vegetables, ready within an hour.

### Ingredients
- 2 cups cooked black soybeans (or canned black soybeans, drained and rinsed)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 medium red bell pepper, sliced thin (about 150 grams)
- 1 medium green bell pepper, sliced thin (about 150 grams)
- 1 medium zucchini, sliced into half-moons (about 200 grams)
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (adjust to taste)
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce (low sodium preferred)
- 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
- Salt and black pepper to taste
- 2 green onions, sliced (for garnish)

### Instructions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat for 2 minutes.
2. Add the sliced bell peppers and zucchini to the skillet. Cook, stirring frequently, for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender but still crisp.
3. Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the empty side and add the minced garlic.
4. Sauté the garlic for 30 seconds until fragrant, then mix it into the vegetables.
5. Add the cooked black soybeans to the skillet. Stir to combine all ingredients.
6. Sprinkle the cumin, smoked paprika, red pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper over the mixture. Stir thoroughly.
7. Pour in the soy sauce and apple cider vinegar. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring to coat everything evenly.
8. Remove from heat. Garnish with sliced green onions.
9. Serve immediately.

### Notes
- Use canned black soybeans to save time; ensure they are rinsed thoroughly.
- Adjust red pepper flakes for spiciness preference.
- Serve hot, with a side of cauliflower rice if desired for additional low-carb volume.
